timeline.message: Temporarily removed links due to plugins.jetbrains.com not responding
Changes due to autotest issue resolutions
#1214 initial Spring 3 version bump
Rollback transactional testing
WIP - spring 5 upgrade
fix: hib fix for Spring 3+
WIP:  Leveraging Spring 3 efforts
WIP:  Continue to leverage Spring 3 efforts
chore: rollback some changes that in fact did not affect the build with the deps upgrade
spring3-upgrade:  More build.sbt tweaks, and fixing a leftover generics issue
Merging in WIP efforts to make hib5 / Spring5  play nice with oEQ
WIP Spring5: More hibernate changes - execute / sql exception
WIP hibernate changes to support Spring / Hib 5
WIP:  Fixed remoting errors
WIP: fixed dedup error with logging
WIP:  updated more deps, hib5 updates
WIP:  More hib5 updates
WIP: exploratory changes to get hib5 to compile
WIP - source compiles!
WIP:  working through the startup issues
WIP:  fixed the el startup issue
oEQ more or less runs on SpringHib5 now
Added license header
Fixed hierarchies
Various hib5 fixes
fixed minor regression
Fixed a lazy load on a detached entity
Upgrade CXF / Tika - CXF was needed for Spring 5
Back to known working (kindof) CXF / Tika versions
CXF 3.4.0 and Tika 1.24.1 is now working locally
Temporarily removed links due to plugins.jetbrains.com not responding
Revert the temp change of link removal
Merge bus-extensions.txt instead of keeping just the first
Better handling of AOP deps, and checking for null objs prior to eviction
SpringHib5 - Rewire Kaltura build branch and add hib5 config
Revisions due to Oracle DB testing
Changes due to autotest issue resolutions
Adjusting comments due to lessons learned
Added missing header to new file
Added missing header to new file

timeline.bodyText:
Is Java 5 in the support matrix?
I thought it was already set to 7 or 8
timeline.author: ChristianMurphy

replies.bodyText:
Sounds right.  I did a search for documentation - our known supported software guide doesn't say - https://openequella.github.io/server-administration/KnownWorkingSupportingSoftware.html
SO - anyone concerned if we set the minimum version to 7, but note the developers only test against JDK 8?
replies.author: cbeach47

replies.bodyText: You'll see in project/CommonSettings.scala that we build to target Java 8. So we should probably update the doco site, but also you're free to target 8 here. ;)
replies.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText:
Sounds good. I've removed the java version comments / checks and opened:
https://github.com/openequella/openequella.github.io/pull/74

to update the docs.
replies.author: cbeach47

timeline.message: New configs for Hib and Log4j are now defaults for installs and upgrades

timeline.bodyText:
Not sure I'm following this new comment. I guess I'm confused that these aren't going through JPA / Hibernate (how are they used), but also that no other changes are below so is this comment still needed?
Feels like the comment might be a bit of a fragment of a bigger situation. 🤔
There's several instances of this comment, so I'm rather interested to understand.
timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.author: cbeach47

replies.bodyText: Good stuff. 👍
replies.author: edalex-ian

timeline.bodyText: FYI - As we update code where it has the old NLS check comments, we've been removing them seeing it's now cruft with the absence any checking. Feel free to do the same.
timeline.author: edalex-ian

timeline.bodyText: Would it be better to keep things simple (even if not enhanced for readability) by simply using i here? If we just want to enhance readability, I would't be opposed to a comment saying: generating ordinal parameter strings of ?0, ?1 .. ?n
timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText: yeah, that's a good point - I switched out paramCounter for i.
replies.author: cbeach47

timeline.bodyText: As before, maybe just use i.
timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText: Sounds good 👍
replies.author: cbeach47

timeline.bodyText:
Couple of considerations:

Is this still needed - or was it just while you were working through things? (This can be see just be turning on Hibernate logging.)
If still needed, maybe the log message can be improved and maybe change " sql:" to " HQL:"
Also consider placing in block of if(LOGGER.isTraceEnabled())
timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText: I find it helpful to look at the query before Hibernate touches it, so I left it in.  I did wrap it in the isTraceEnabled block and improved the messaging.
replies.author: cbeach47

timeline.bodyText:
Gah!
Well, even the GitHub diff broken down on this one. But from what I can tell it looks like you were careful. Are you giving some extra special testing to this?
timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText:
The changes in this file were a handful of casts, and an import path switch.  The github diff unfortunately makes it look quite ugly.
For clarity, these are the type castings added:
replies.author: cbeach47

timeline.bodyText: Wow, I see this class was using a mixture of these annotations. Well, at least that's now tidied up. 👍
timeline.author: edalex-ian

timeline.bodyText:
In this case I see the value of paramCounter. 👍
(Just thought I'd mention to avoid an ambiguity.)
timeline.author: edalex-ian

timeline.bodyText: Is this TODO still to be done?
timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText: mmm leftover comment.  I'll clean it up
replies.author: cbeach47

timeline.bodyText: Oh! Is that right? Seems like a significant change and I don't see it in the old code. 🤔 😕
timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText: Thanks for calling this out - interesting logic on this one.  I've added a comment in the code to explain why MANUAL is chosen.  @edalex-ian Please let me know if there are further questions on this one.
replies.author: cbeach47

timeline.bodyText: I'd normally comment about moving away from the iterator... However in the context and size of this PR, minimal change is good. 😄
timeline.author: edalex-ian

timeline.bodyText: I'm concerned this could impact start-up times and load - even if only minor. Could this be wrapped in a isTraceEnabled() check please?
timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText: yep, done.
replies.author: cbeach47

timeline.bodyText:
That could be for good reason, as it possibly implies we're in an unexpected state - but would depend on how oEQ is written.
To match your new if block I wonder if there is value having an else to log a warning. (Of it it's super prevalent, maybe at a lower log level.)
timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText: I like the idea of not just swallowing the null object state.  I added a warning and will check the logs during tests - it's currently the only logging statement in the class, so if it gets noisy, it's simple enough to switch off.
replies.author: cbeach47

timeline.bodyText: This could be brittle. Are we better to have a look at the cause and/or stack trace and check the class, method or file?
timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText:
It may work as well to bind to the stack trace, class, or other indicator(s).  However, after further consideration of the situation, I feel it’s sufficient to bind to the message than a specific stack trace, given the message specificity.
I did end up removing the error logging below this statement - it proved to just be creating noise.
replies.author: cbeach47

replies.bodyText: I guess the only difference if it does break is that a debug log message will be missing, so no probs. 😉
replies.author: edalex-ian

timeline.bodyText: Should raise a matching GitHub issue and reference here.
timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText: Ended up just removing the internal reference.
replies.author: cbeach47

timeline.bodyText: All the additional logging has made this method now rather long and cumbersome - especially when combined with all the branching and nesting. I think now it needs to be split into it's core parts as part of this.
timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText: Fair point - This is split out now
replies.author: cbeach47

timeline.bodyText: Eeck! Am I reading this wrong? To me it seems sqlStrings should have ... SQL. It would seem this should have been another LOGGER.debug() followed by sqlStrings.add(sql)?

timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,50 @@
+/*

+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
+ * limitations under the License.
+ */
+
+package com.tle.hibernate.dialect;
+
+import java.util.Iterator;
+import org.apache.commons.logging.Log;
+import org.apache.commons.logging.LogFactory;
+import org.hibernate.dialect.Dialect;
+import org.hibernate.dialect.unique.DefaultUniqueDelegate;
+import org.hibernate.mapping.Table;
+import org.hibernate.mapping.UniqueKey;
+
+// Standard Hib 5.3+ does not include the unique constraints
+//  in the create table logic, so we need to add our own.

timeline.bodyText:
Could void the iterator and go with:
    StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
    table.getUniqueKeyIterator()
      .forEachRemaining(uniqueKey ->
        sb
          .append(", ")
          .append(uniqueConstraintSql(uniqueKey)));
Be nice to take it to a stream so you could simply reduce, but.... You're starting from an Iterator. 😞
timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText: works for me - done.
replies.author: cbeach47

timeline.bodyText: That is interesting. Wonder if it still even works, or if it should be removed. Wonder if it'd be worth raising a GitHub ticket for someone to check. 🤷
timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText: Can't hurt - I opened #2508
replies.author: cbeach47

timeline.bodyText:
Could you please add a JavaDoc description.
I gather it is only handling Join table bits, and the rest is all for logging. If so, two things:

The JavaDoc should capture that, and I wonder if we should have a more explicit class name - on the assumption that if we needed more we add them;
If we only have all the other methods for logging, do we need them? Or if one wanted to see what was happening should they just turn the logging on for ImplicitNamingStrategyJpaCompliantImpl?
timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText:
Currently all dialects use the same naming strategies, so the name implies it's the oEQ strategy.  If it a dialect needs to branch off into it's own future, I lean towards renaming at that point.
The overridden methods to inject logging was noisy.  I removed those and guarded the trace statements.
replies.author: cbeach47

timeline.bodyText: Be nice if this had a isTraceEnabled() guard. And to save excessive messages - same with all the below trace messages where strings are being dynamically constructed.
timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText: done.
replies.author: cbeach47

timeline.bodyText: Need GitHub Issue and ref.
timeline.author: edalex-ian

timeline.bodyText: If it is still limited to lowercase naming of tables, then really the name it had before should remain.
timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText: It's not only lower-casing the table names, and in the spirit of the theory behind the Implicit Naming Strategy, I'd like to leave it general for now.  I updated the javadoc to help reflect that mindset.
replies.author: cbeach47

timeline.bodyText: isTraceEnabled() guard.
timeline.author: edalex-ian

timeline.bodyText: As per elsewhere. I think this is the fourth or so, but if they all have the GitHub issue reference they'll be easy to fix when the time comes.
timeline.author: edalex-ian

timeline.bodyText: Yup, as per above I don't believe we will run with < 8.
timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText: resolved as per above.
replies.author: cbeach47

timeline.bodyText: Heh, nice pick up. 👍
timeline.author: edalex-ian

timeline.bodyText: Could be good value in adding a JavaDoc description here with a synopsis of what upgrade steps are needed/included.
timeline.author: edalex-ian
